taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family rosaceae;tribe rubeae;genus rubus;subgenus eubatus;section setosi;species ascendens;

treatment.description: Canes 0.6-1.2 m. high, with 60-100 strong subulate prickles per dm., these often 6-9 mm. long and with bases 2-3 mm. broad; leaves tomentose beneath; terminal leaflet of primocane-foliage ovate to elliptic, acuminate, yellow-green, its petiolule1.2-2.5 cm. long; raceme or corymb leafy-bracted below, its axis and pedicels unarmed or only sparingly armed.
treatment.habitat_elevation_distribution_or_ecolog: Open thickets, fields and borders of woods, s. N.E. Fl. June, early July; fr. late Aug., Sept.
